breweries.name: Shepherd Neame
breweries.description: Shepherd Neame is an English regional brewery founded in 1698 in Faversham, Kent. It is the oldest brewer in Great Britain and has been family-owned since 1864.

breweries.name: BearWaters Brewing Company
breweries.description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

data.name: Smoke Detection
data.description: English style Mild ale brewed with cherry wood smoked malt. Smokey, toasty aroma - tobacco paper, cigars and woodsy. Bold smoke flavor, earthy, dark malts. Rustic, Unfiltered, cloudy and deep brown.

breweries.name: Finback Brewery
breweries.description: Our goal is to make great beer following our passion for richness and complexity from quality ingredients and small batch artisanal brewing. We focus on pushing American styles and brewing flavorful, unique beers to drink. We like it hoppy and complex to roasty and smokey, strong and sippable to session and gulpable. Most importantly we like it happy and enjoyable. Something to drink with friends, in the backyard, at the beach and at the bar. We make beer because we like to drink and we like to smile.

data.name: Stock Ale
data.description: This is an English style ale. Amber in color, a caramel sweet body balanced with a generous portion of East Kent Goldings hops for a floral finish. Pale, carapils, crystal and black malts are used exclusively with East Kent Golding hops.

breweries.name: Rock Art Brewery
breweries.description:
Matt began the brewery in the basement of our home in 1997. Wow! I can't believe I let him do that! His first beer was Whitetail Ale. A nice crisp refreshing golden ale. I was really enjoying wheat beers at the time. I guess that's why I let him start Rock Art! The Brewery was ready to leave home and move to it's own place down the road in Morrisville, VT in 2001. We are still located there and now have a terrific space for people to come and visit. Come on by and say hello!

Our Mission is to offer our friends and family a wonderful beer at the end of the day!

data.name: Sunderland English Mild
data.description: Our light dark beer. Think of a light beer but with color, body and flavor—brown ale’s little brother. This style was originally brewed to quench the thirst of coal miners and other laborers without the intoxicating effects of the stronger pale ales and stouts. Our was originally brewed to celebrate Sunderland (UK) Football Club's ascension to the Premier League in May 2007. It proved so popular we've kept it as a year-round ale. Floor malted barley and an English yeast strain impart an authentic English flavor. Lighter alcohol that Bud or Miller lights.

breweries.name: Worth Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Backed by the support of countless friends and neighbors, Worth Brewing Company opened on March 17, 2007. Its owners, the husband-and-wife team of Peter Ausenhus and Margaret Bishop, have lived near Northwood since their purchase of a nearby farmhouse and acreage in 1998. Nebraska natives, Peter and Margaret lived and worked in Minneapolis for many years before moving to Worth County, where Peter’s grandparents had lived and farmed and where Peter had spent much time as a boy.

 Having already established Margaret’s engineering business in downtown Northwood, the couple turned next to Peter’s passion – brewing great beer. For 24 years, Peter has brewed award-winning beer, winning contests, teaching others and perfecting classic recipes along the way. He’s a BJCP National Beer Judge, has brewed professionally with Summit Brewing Company of St. Paul, Minn., and worked on staff at one of the country’s most popular brewing supply shops.

Worth Brewing Company is Peter and Margaret’s way of helping to reintroduce a great tradition – the locally owned brewery serving hand-crafted, high-quality, distinctive beers for the enjoyment of locals and lucky visitors. The nation’s small and mid-sized towns were once dotted with such breweries. Today, Worth Brewing – perhaps one of the world’s smallest craft brewers – brings a bit of those days back to delight the growing number of those who appreciate fine, locally brewed beers.

breweries.name: Stone Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing Co. is the 10th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list nine times, and has been called the “All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth” by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. The multi-faceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently own and operate facilities in Berlin, Germany and also has plans to open operations east of the Mississippi. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.

data.name: The Little Spree
data.description: This is a deceptively simple recipe, relying on quality raw ingredients and excellent yeast health for a clean beer without flaws. One malt and three hops makes for an approachable, refreshing beer that can still be enjoyed for its delicate complex flavors. An ode to a wonderful base malt, Golden Promise, and classic European hop varieties.

data.name: Trilby
data.description:
No one drinks Mild Ales anymore (not outside the Black Country anyway), but not so long ago London's biggest breweries churned them out in phenominal quantities and Mild was very much of the London drinking scene.

An X ale would be the most basic mild, so an XX is the next step up, hence the 4.0% ABV.

The Florence pub is a major South London landmark and home to the Florence Brewery, which is home both to beers produced under the Florence name and the A Head In A Hat range. The Florence Brewery is looking forward to building a name for itself as part of the vibrant life of South London and let’s face it, what we do is . . .

Too good for North London!

breweries.name: Straight to Ale
breweries.description:
We are working hard to provide our hometown of Huntsville, Alabama with top quality, full flavored beer in styles ranging from English brown ales to American Imperial IPA’s and everything in between. You can find our beer on draft at many local restaurants,bottle shops, and bars. If we’re not already on tap at your favorite hang-out, please ask them why not!

Straight To Ale’s products are distributed throughout our great state of Alabama, as well as our friendly neighbors: Tennessee, Mississippi, Georgia, and Florida.

breweries.name: New Holland Brewing Company
breweries.description:
New Holland Brewing Company’s deep roots in the craft industry go back to 1997. Our role as an integral member of the artisan approach is something we take seriously, yet engage lightheartedly.

We believe the art of craft lives in fostering rich experiences for our customers, through creating authentic beer, spirits and food while providing great service. Recognized for our creativity and artistry, our mission to improve the lives of craft consumers everywhere is seen in our diverse, balanced collection of beer and spirits.

locations.hoursOfOperation: Brewery tours are at Noon and 3pm. Tours are $10 per person and include samples of our beer as well as a take-home New Holland pint glass.

breweries.name: Birreria
breweries.description: Birreria is a rooftop restaurant and brewery that offers the highest quality beer and food under the stars and skyline. In collaboration with Sam Calagione of Dogfish Head, Teo Musso of Baladin and Leonardo Di Vincenzo of Birra Del Borgo, Eataly's Head Brewer is brewing unfiltered, unpasteurized and naturally carbonated Cask Ales just 30 feet from where you sit, eat and drink. Each is served through traditional hand pumps, at the perfect temperature, so you can enjoy our beers in the most natural and traditional way. The menu conjures the family style feasts of an Italy influenced by Austria and Germany. The focus on hearty fare feels convivial and comforting (deeply flavorful mushroom entrees, beer braised pork shoulder, housemade sausages and grilled meats). Don't worry about the weather,  our retractable roof and heaters keeps us open in all seasons; rain, shine or snow!

data.name: Whiskey J.
data.description: Often you will find some whiskey in J. Henry, but what about some J. Henry in whiskey? We stuffed him in a whiskey barrel and he came back out smooth as ever, complex AND compelling, yet the most drinkable barrel aged beer you may ever have.

data.name: Wild River
data.description: This superb double hopped beer, brewed to 4.5% ABV, uses a unique blend of four American hops imported from the West Coast - Liberty, Willamette, Cascade and Chinook . The result is a beer bursting with citrus hop flavours that are sure to leave you wanting more. The beer will be available exclusively to Fuller’s pubs, with some selected free trade pubs stocking the beer later in the season.

breweries.name: The Dandy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Dandy Brewing Company is Calgary’s true Nano-Brewery. We produce inspired ales, with lots of care, in very small batches.

Our custom built, 3BBL brew-house ensures a keen eye to every detail and fosters creativity in both our recipes and beer styles.

Dandy Ales are living beers; naturally conditioned bottles, kegs, and casks. This return to the true ale tradition ensures the living yeast in the unfiltered and unpasteurized beer will continue to work with the premium malt and complex hops from the moment it is pitched in the fermenters, until it passes your lips!

We are pleased to offer a top notch tasting room on site where you can taste any or all of our eight taps, including Dandy favourites and special one-off beers. There are also tours and a small shop to pick up a variety of Dandy merchandise!

We share a passion for not only brewing, but the people, process, experiences, and personal touches that make the real ale experience so special.

data.name: Winter Ale
data.description:
Whether during a night at the pub or fun in the snow, we get together with our friends and family in the wintertime to celebrate our good fortune and look ahead to brighter days. 

Celebrate those times with our Winter Ale, a mild ale we created using unique ingredients of the holiday season that will help warm you on those long, cold evenings. 

Saigon cinnamon and vanilla introduce you to this smooth ale which features a medium body and a smooth finish with hints of orange peel and chocolate. 

This medium-brown ale is just the thing to take home in a growler filled at our Bloomington brewpub at Lennie's Restaurant. Cheers to the season from BBC to you and yours.

In addition to the hops and malts listed below, BBC Winter Ale also features these adjuncts: Cocoa Nibs, Orange Peel, Hungarian and Whiskey Oak, Saigon Cinnamon, Vanilla Bean.

breweries.name: Bloomington Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Philosophy—
Life without labor is guilt. 
Labor without art is brutality—John Rusgan

There is a nearly infinite variety of ways to make good beer. At the Bloomington Brewing Company, we make beers that we like to drink. That’s the first rule. Great ingredients and attention to detail is the second. Our intention is not to grow a large brewery operation, our intention is to make great beer that we like to drink and to take care of our community.

We make only ales and they are available only on draft in Bloomington, Indianapolis and the surrounding communities. We do not bottle our beers. We’re not against bottling, and we will assuredly reach a point in the future where we will package our beer, but no matter how good a beer is in the bottle, it can never be better than the beer coming from a well managed tap. Often it will be not nearly as good. Why? Draft beer is fresher; that’s a big one. Packaging beer is a complicated process with lots of potential for bad things to happen. Once packaged, the beer is exposed to its two mortal enemies; Sunlight and time.

data.name: X-3134 Mild Ale
data.description: Mild ale as in mild hop bitterness where malt flavor dominates and is highly sessionable with low alcohol allowing you to drink many but stay vertical. Our Mild features a light yet complex caramel, toffee and nutty flavor and aroma. It has a beautiful crystal clear copper color with an off white head and medium body. This beer pairs well with hearty foods like grilled steak, roast pork, smoked sausage but does especially well with Mexican and spicy foods. A portion of sales go to support the Beer Army Vigilant Guardian Foundation.

breweries.name: Beer Army Combat Brewery
breweries.description: The Beer Army Combat Brewery is a micro brewery located in Trenton, North Carolina. The brewery opened on April 19th, 2013 in the small town of 287 people.  The brewery maintains a tap room called the "Bunker" where patrons can come sit and drink inside the brewery.  Head Brewer Jeff Brungard retired from the Marine Corps in late 2012.  Owner Dustin Canestorp is currently enlisted as a Major.
